content.transcript:
It is essential to destroy food poisoning bacteria in food before it is eaten.

  • Food should be cooked thoroughly to 75°C core temperature, or equivalent time and temperature combination, at the coolest point.
  • Chemicals and preservatives discourage the multiplication of bacteria.
  • Food irradiation destroys bacteria in food.
  • Heat processing, such as pasteurisation, sterilisation or canning will destroy bacteria.
  • Ultraviolet light is used to destroy bacteria in water.

page.statement: It is essential to destroy any food poisoning bacteria in food before it is eaten:
page.bullet: Food should be cooked thoroughly to 75°C core temperature or equivalent time and temperature combination, at the coolest point
Heat processing such as pasteurisation, sterilisation or canning
Ultraviolet (UV) light can be used to destroy bacteria in water.
